Identification_Area.title: Voyager 2 DSS-49 X RCP Uranus Open Loop Raw Data from 1986-01-24T23:21:41.000000Z to 1986-01-24T23:28:20.000000Z

Citation_Information.description: Voyager 2 DSS-49 X-band RCP open loop data from Uranus from 1986-01-24T23:21:41.000000Z to 1986-01-24T23:28:20.000000Z. This product includes the original binary data file plus an ASCII data file with record headers, an ASCII file with column headers for the ASCII header data file, and an ASCII file with the open loop X-band data samples.

Modification_Detail.description:
This data product has been restored from an Original Data Record (ODR) with identifier UL0323 to PDS4. The original data file has been parsed into an ASCII file containing record headers and an ASCII file containing data samples. A PDS4 label has been created.
The ODR format in this product is described by DSN Software Interface Specification (SIS) RSC-11-9 dated 1 March 1982. This format was used for data collection at the Parkes Observatory (Australia) during the Voyager 2 encounter with Uranus. The Parkes format is slightly different from the format used at the DSN complex near Canberra (Australia) during the same encounter. The Parkes format may be identified as PODR to distinguish it from the ODR collected at Canberra.
Original files with names including the character 'x' have been corrected for one or more defective records. See the archive SIS for details.

Primary_Result_Summary.description: Voyager 2 DSS-49 X-band open loop raw data from Uranus from 1986-01-24T23:21:41.000000Z to 1986-01-24T23:28:20.000000Z

Internal_Reference.comment: Reference document for Radio Science open loop data in the PODR fomat as used by data acquisition equipment at Parkes Observatory during the Voyager 2 encounter with Uranus.

Field_Binary.name: ADC Block Format
Field_Binary.description: First byte of each record gives record status.

Field_Bit.name: Time and Status Validity
Field_Bit.description: Indicates that time-tag data in Words 6 through 9 are valid for this record. 0 = invalid 1 = valid

Field_Bit.name: Sequence Flag
Field_Bit.description: Indicates that this record is the start of a sequence block. 1 = start of a sequence block 0 = continuation

Field_Bit.name: Master Tape Error Flag
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether there was an error in the master tape. 0 = no error in master tape. 1 = error in master tape

Field_Bit.name: Conversion Flag
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether data were converted. 0 = 8-bit conversion 1 = 12-bit conversion

Field_Bit.name: Compression Factor Type Indicator
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether data have been compressed. 0001 = narrow band data, no compression 0010 = narrow band, compression by 2 1010 = narrow band, compression by 10

Field_Binary.name: Tape Number
Field_Binary.description: The number of the tape in this sequence (starting from 1)

Field_Binary.name: Record Number
Field_Binary.description: Number of the record in this tape, starting from 1.

Field_Binary.name: Record Length
Field_Binary.description: Length of this record (in bytes).

Field_Binary.name: Spacecraft Identifier
Field_Binary.description: Identifier for spacecraft. Expected value is 32 (for Voyager 2).

Field_Binary.name: Source Station
Field_Binary.description: Identifier for the source antenna. Set to 43, which is incorrect. The true DSS identifier for Parkes Observatory was 49.

Field_Binary.name: Date and Time
Field_Binary.description: Day of year and seconds of day.

Field_Bit.name: Day of Year
Field_Bit.description: Day of year, expressed as a 9-bit binary number between 1 and 366 (inclusive).

Field_Bit.name: Zeroes-1
Field_Bit.description: An unused field, set to 0.

Field_Bit.name: Seconds of Day
Field_Bit.description: Seconds of day, expressed as a 17-bit binary number between 0 and 86399.

Field_Binary.name: Predict Set ID
Field_Binary.description: A four character identifier for the predict set used to control receiver tuning.

Field_Binary.name: POCA Status
Field_Binary.description: One byte of POCA status flags followed by the POCA frequency (7 bytes)

Field_Bit.name: Control Mode
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether the POCA is under manual or computer control. 0 = computer control (normal radio science usage) 1 = manual control

Field_Bit.name: Control Ready
Field_Bit.description: POCA computer control is ready (or not) 0 = not ready 1 = ready (normal radio science usage)

Field_Bit.name: Synthesizer Power
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether there was an error in the master tape. 0 = synthesizer power is OFF 1 = synthesizer power is ON (normal radio science usage)

Field_Bit.name: Synthesizer Lock Status
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether the synthesizer ias in lock (or not) 0 = not in lock 1 = in lock (normal radio science usage)

Field_Bit.name: Limit Enable
Field_Bit.description: Indicates limit is enabled 0 = limit enable is OFF (normal radio science usage) 1 = limit enable is ON

Field_Bit.name: Track Status
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether tracking is ON 0 = tracking is OFF 1 = tracking is ON (normal radio science usage)

Field_Bit.name: Acquisition Status
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether acquisition is ON 0 = acquisition is OFF 1 = acquisition is ON (normal radio science usage)

Field_Bit.name: Sweep Status
Field_Bit.description: Indicates whether sweep is ON 0 = sweep is OFF 1 = sweep is ON (normal radio science usage)

Group_Field_Binary.name: POCA Frequency
Group_Field_Binary.description: Each 8-bit field contains two binary-coded decimal digits. The 14 digits in the 7 repetitions give the POCA frequency in microhertz at the Date and Time in Field 7. Expected values are about 46 10**12 microhertz.

Field_Binary.name: POCA Digit Pair
Field_Binary.description: A pair of 4-bit binary-coded decimal digits. For example, the bit string 10000101 is the decimal digit pair '85'.

Packed_Data_Fields.description: A pair of binary-coded decimal digits.

Field_Bit.name: First Digit
Field_Bit.description: The first of two digits in a 14-character string giving the POCA frequency.

Field_Bit.name: Second Digit
Field_Bit.description: The second of two digits in a 14-character string giving the POCA frequency.

Field_Binary.name: Zeroes-2
Field_Binary.description: An unused byte set to 0.

Field_Binary.name: POCA Rate
Field_Binary.description: The POCA rate given as a mantissa, exponent, and sign.

Packed_Data_Fields.description: The POCA rate given as a mantissa (5 binary-coded decimal digit with fixed point before the first digit), a 3-bit exponent (giving the power to ten multiplier for the mantissa), and a sign bit.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Mantissa Digit 1
Field_Bit.description: The first digit in the POCA rate mantissa, after the fixed decimal point. It is a binary-coded decimal number. For example the bit string 0011 should be interpreted as '3'.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Mantissa Digit 2
Field_Bit.description: The second digit in the POCA rate mantissa, after the fixed decimal point. It is a binary-coded decimal number. For example the bit string 0010 should be interpreted as '2'.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Mantissa Digit 3
Field_Bit.description: The third digit in the POCA rate mantissa, after the fixed decimal point. It is a binary-coded decimal number. For example the bit string 0110 should be interpreted as '6'.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Mantissa Digit 4
Field_Bit.description: The fourth digit in the POCA rate mantissa, after the fixed decimal point. It is a binary-coded decimal number. For example the bit string 0111 should be interpreted as '7'.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Mantissa Digit 5
Field_Bit.description: The fifth digit in the POCA rate mantissa, after the fixed decimal point. It is a binary-coded decimal number. For example the bit string 1001 should be interpreted as '9'.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Exponent
Field_Bit.description: The power of ten multiplier for the POCA frequency rate. It is a binary number. For example, the bit string 010 means that the mantissa should be multiplied by 10**2.

Field_Bit.name: POCA Rate - Sign
Field_Bit.description: The sign of the POCA frequency rate. 0 = negative (-) 1 = positive (+)

Field_Binary.name: Converter Sampling Rate
Field_Binary.description: The sampling rate of one analog-to-digital converter.

Field_Binary.name: Signal Select
Field_Binary.description: Four 2-bit flags that show the input signal assignments to the four analog-to-digital converters.

Packed_Data_Fields.description: Assignments of input signal(s) to analog-to-gitial converters.

Field_Bit.name: Signal to ADC-1
Field_Bit.description: Signal assigned to ADC-1. 00 = signal 1 is assigned to ADC-1 01 = signal 2 is assigned to ADC-1 02 = signal 3 is assigned to ADC-1 03 = signal 4 is assigned to ADC-1

Field_Bit.name: Signal to ADC-2
Field_Bit.description: Signal assigned to ADC-2. 00 = signal 1 is assigned to ADC-2 01 = signal 2 is assigned to ADC-2 02 = signal 3 is assigned to ADC-2 03 = signal 4 is assigned to ADC-2

Field_Bit.name: Signal to ADC-3
Field_Bit.description: Signal assigned to ADC-3. 00 = signal 1 is assigned to ADC-3 01 = signal 2 is assigned to ADC-3 02 = signal 3 is assigned to ADC-3 03 = signal 4 is assigned to ADC-3

Field_Bit.name: Signal to ADC-4
Field_Bit.description: Signal assigned to ADC-4. 00 = signal 1 is assigned to ADC-4 01 = signal 2 is assigned to ADC-4 02 = signal 3 is assigned to ADC-4 03 = signal 4 is assigned to ADC-4

Field_Binary.name: N Counter
Field_Binary.description: The value N where N = 257 - M, M = 10**7/(20*SRATE), and SRATE is the Converter Sampling Rate in Field 12. Allowable values for M are 250, 125, 100, 50, and 25.

Field_Binary.name: Cumulative Phase - Counter 1 - High Part
Field_Binary.description: The high part of Cumulative Phase as measured by Counter 1 (H1). Total phase in cycles is H1*2**24 + M1*2**8 + L1*2**-8.

Field_Binary.name: Cumulative Phase - Counter 1 - Mid Part
Field_Binary.description: The mid part of Cumulative Phase as measured by Counter 1 (M1). Total phase in cycles is H1*2**24 + M1*2**8 + L1*2**-8.

Field_Binary.name: Cumulative Phase - Counter 1 - Low Part
Field_Binary.description: The low part of Cumulative Phase as measured by Counter 1 (L1). Total phase in cycles is H1*2**24 + M1*2**8 + L1*2**-8.

Field_Binary.name: Cumulative Phase - Counter 2 - High Part
Field_Binary.description: The high part of Cumulative Phase as measured by Counter 2 (H2). Total phase in cycles is H2*2**24 + M2*2**8 + L2*2**-8.

Field_Binary.name: Cumulative Phase - Counter 2 - Mid Part
Field_Binary.description: The mid part of Cumulative Phase as measured by Counter 2 (M2). Total phase in cycles is H2*2**24 + M2*2**8 + L2*2**-8.

Field_Binary.name: Cumulative Phase - Counter 2 - Low Part
Field_Binary.description: The low part of Cumulative Phase as measured by Counter 2 (L2). Total phase in cycles is H2*2**24 + M2*2**8 + L2*2**-8.

Field_Binary.name: Frequency Counter Status
Field_Binary.description: Frequency counter status.

Packed_Data_Fields.description: Four flags giving status of frequency counters.

Field_Bit.name: Test Signal Selection
Field_Bit.description: Test signal selection. Possible values include: 0001 = Live input of Counter 1 (POCA) 0010 = Live input of counter 2 1000 = 1 MHz

Field_Bit.name: Sample Control Register
Field_Bit.description: Sample Control Register: 1011 = Enable live sample; internal 10 MHz to resolvers and test facilities.

Field_Bit.name: Frequency Counter 1 Mode Register
Field_Bit.description: Frequency Counter 1 Mode Register -- binary values: 0000 = Test frequency to counter 0001 = Live frequency to counter (POCA)

Field_Bit.name: Frequency Counter 2 Mode Register
Field_Bit.description: Frequency Counter 2 Mode Register -- binary values: 0000 = Test frequency to counter 0001 = Live frequency to counter (POCA)

Field_Binary.name: Spares-1
Field_Binary.description: Usually zeroes; but the low order byte is set to "1" if the samples in the original tape record were truncated. In that case the samples in the record were filled out to the normal record length with whatever values happened to be available, record bytes 4057-4090 were set to zero, and this low order byte (byte 48) was set to "1".

Field_Binary.name: Zeroes-3
Field_Binary.description: Unused, set to zero.

Field_Binary.name: 20 Counter - Value 1
Field_Binary.description: According to the SIS, always octal 023. In fact, the value appears to be decimal 23 in Voyager 2 Uranus data from Parkes.

Field_Binary.name: 20 Counter - Value 2
Field_Binary.description: A copy of Field 24.

Field_Binary.name: Zeroes-4
Field_Binary.description: Unused, set to zero.

Field_Binary.name: Sampling Strategy - Value 1
Field_Binary.description: Sampling status - first set of values (repeated in Field 28).

Packed_Data_Fields.description: Five flags giving status of sampling.

Field_Bit.name: Overflow Indicator - 1
Field_Bit.description: Overflow flag: 0 = no overflow 1 = overflow

Field_Bit.name: Ones-1
Field_Bit.description: Unused, set to all ones (decimal 7).

Field_Bit.name: Test Mode - 1
Field_Bit.description: Flag indicating test or normal mode. 0 = normal 1 = test

Field_Bit.name: Short Conversions - 1
Field_Bit.description: Flag confirming bits per sample: 0 = 12-bit samples 1 = 8-bit samples

Field_Bit.name: Sampling Mode - 1
Field_Bit.description: Sampling configuration. Binary values as follows: 00 = 4 signals, each sampled by a separate ADC at SRATE (Field 12) 01 = 1 signal, effectively sampled at 4*SRATE 10 = 2 signals, each effectively sampled at 2*SRATE 11 = 1 signal sampled at SRATE using ADC-1 and 1 signal effectively sampled at 3*SRATE sequentially using ADC-2, ADC-3, and ADC-4

Field_Binary.name: Sampling Strategy - Value 2
Field_Binary.description: Sampling status - second set of values (a copy of Field 27).

Packed_Data_Fields.description: Five flags giving status of sampling.

Field_Bit.name: Overflow Indicator - 2
Field_Bit.description: Overflow flag: 0 = no overflow 1 = overflow

Field_Bit.name: Ones-2
Field_Bit.description: Unused, set to all ones (decimal 7).

Field_Bit.name: Test Mode - 2
Field_Bit.description: Flag indicating test or normal mode. 0 = normal 1 = test

Field_Bit.name: Short Conversions - 2
Field_Bit.description: Flag indicating bits per sample: 0 = 12-bit samples 1 = 8-bit samples

Field_Bit.name: Sampling Mode - 2
Field_Bit.description: Sampling configuration. Binary values as follows: 00 = 4 signals, each sampled by a separate ADC at SRATE (Field 12) 01 = 1 signal, effectively sampled at 4*SRATE 10 = 2 signals, each effectively sampled at 2*SRATE 11 = 1 signal sampled at SRATE using ADC-1 and 1 signal effectively sampled at 3*SRATE sequentially using ADC-2, ADC-3, and ADC-4

Group_Field_Binary.name: PODR Samples
Group_Field_Binary.description: 4000 8-bit samples captured during the Voyager 2 Uranus encounter at Parkes Observatory.

Field_Binary.name: POCA Sample
Field_Binary.description: Each sample has a value between 0 and 255. The first sample is from ADC-1 at the time given by Field 7 (if valid). The second sample is from ADC-2 at one sample interval later. The third sample is from ADC-3 one sample interval after ADC-2. The fourth sample is from ADC-4 one sample interval after ADC-3. The fifth sample is from ADC-1 one sample interval after ADC-4. And so on.

Group_Field_Binary.name: Trailer
Group_Field_Binary.description: 34 bytes of trailer data, not used for Voyager 2 Uranus data acquisition.

Field_Binary.name: Unused
Field_Binary.description: Byte not used during Voyager 2 Uranus data acquisition.

Table_Character.name: PODR Headers in ASCII
Table_Character.description: PODR record headers in ASCII. Translation of binary fields in PODR records to ASCII. Duplicates -- namely bytes 51-52 and 55-56 -- have not been retained. The record number (not in the binary file) has been prepended to the ASCII record to facilitate use. The table has fixed width columns, delimited by ASCII commas.

Field_Character.name: Record Number
Field_Character.description: Record number. This field does not exist in the binary file. It was added for user convenience in tracking records in the ASCII file.

Field_Character.name: O_Flag
Field_Character.description: Time and status validity flag. A value 1 means that time and status information in Fields 12-22 is valid.

Field_Character.name: S_Flag
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that this record starts a new sequence of records. A value 0 indicates that this record is a continuation of an existing sequence.

Field_Character.name: E-Flag
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that the master tape from which this record was copied had an error. A value 0 indicates that there was no error on the master tape.

Field_Character.name: C-Flag
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that the data samples in this record have 12-bit sample resolution. A value 0 indicates that the samples have 8-bit resolution.

Field_Character.name: T-Flag
Field_Character.description: The Compression factor type indicator. The following bit strings are valid values: 0001 = narrowband, no compression 0010 = narrowband 2 1010 = narrowband 10

Field_Character.name: Tape Number
Field_Character.description: The tape number within the sequence identified by S-Flag (Field 3).

Field_Character.name: Record Number
Field_Character.description: The record number within the file.

Field_Character.name: Record Length
Field_Character.description: Record length in 16-bit words.

Field_Character.name: Spacecraft Identifier
Field_Character.description: The numerical identifier for the spacecraft. Possible values include: 31 Voyager 1 32 Voyager 2

Field_Character.name: DSS Identifier
Field_Character.description: The numerical identifier for the DSN antenna through which the data were acquired. For Voyager 2 data from Uranus captured using the Parkes antenna, the value was set to 43 for hardware compatibility; however, the actual identifier for Parkes was 49.

Field_Character.name: Day of Year
Field_Character.description: The day of year at the start of this tape/file. For Voyager 2 Uranus data captured using the Parkes antenna, the year was 1986 (not included in the binary file).

Field_Character.name: Seconds of Day
Field_Character.description: The time in integer seconds (since UTC midnight) at the most recent valid time signal (Field 2).

Field_Character.name: Predict Set ID
Field_Character.description: A 4-character identifier for the set of predictions used to tune the receiver.

Field_Character.name: POCA Control
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that the Programmable Oscillator Control Assembly (POCA) was under manual control. A value 0 indicates that the POCA was under computer control. Computer control was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: POCA Control Status
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that the POCA was READY. A value 0 indicates that the POCA was NOT READY. READY was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: Synthesizer Power
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that synthesizer power was ON. A value 0 indicates that synthesizer power was OFF. ON was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: Synthesizer Lock
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that the synthesizer was IN-LOCK. A value 0 indicates that the synthesizer was OUT-OF-LOCK. IN-LOCK was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: Limit Enable
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that the POCA limit enable was ON. A value 0 indicates that the POCA limit enable was OFF. OFF was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: Track
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that track was ON. A value 0 indicates that track was OFF. ON was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: Acquisition
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that acquisition was ON. A value 0 indicates that acquisition was OFF. OFF was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: Sweep
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that sweep was ON. A value 0 indicates that sweep was OFF. ON was normal radio science usage.

Field_Character.name: POCA Frequency
Field_Character.description: The frequency of the POCA at the time given in Field 13.

Field_Character.name: POCA Rate
Field_Character.description: The rate of change in the POCA frequency at the time given in Field 13.

Field_Character.name: Sample Rate
Field_Character.description: The sampling rate of one analog-to-digital converter (ADC) in the data acquisition system. Four ADCs are available.

Field_Character.name: J1 Signal Select
Field_Character.description: The signal selected as input to ADC-1. Possible values are: 0 = signal 1 1 = signal 2 2 = signal 3 3 = signal 4

Field_Character.name: J2 Signal Select
Field_Character.description: The signal selected as input to ADC-2. Possible values are: 0 = signal 1 1 = signal 2 2 = signal 3 3 = signal 4

Field_Character.name: J3 Signal Select
Field_Character.description: The signal selected as input to ADC-2. Possible values are: 0 = signal 1 1 = signal 2 2 = signal 3 3 = signal 4

Field_Character.name: J4 Signal Select
Field_Character.description: The signal selected as input to ADC-2. Possible values are: 0 = signal 1 1 = signal 2 2 = signal 3 3 = signal 4

Field_Character.name: N Counter
Field_Character.description: A value derived from the sampling rate SRATE (Field 25). N = 257 - M where M = 10**7/(20*SRATE) Allowable values for M are 250, 125, 100, 50, and 25.

Field_Character.name: Frequency Counter 1 Cumulative Phase
Field_Character.description: Cumulative phase from Frequency Counter 1 in units of 2**-8 cycles.

Field_Character.name: Frequency Counter 2 Cumulative Phase
Field_Character.description: Cumulative phase from Frequency Counter 2 in units of 2**-8 cycles.

Field_Character.name: Test Signal Select
Field_Character.description: Test signal selection. Possible bit string values are: 0001 = live input of Counter 1 (POCA) 0010 = live input of Counter 2 1000 = 1 MHz

Field_Character.name: Sample Control Register
Field_Character.description: Possible (bit string) values include: 1011 = Enable live sample; internal to 10 MHz resolvers and test facilities

Field_Character.name: Frequency Counter 1 Mode Register
Field_Character.description: Possible (bit string) values include: 0000 = Test frequency to counter 0001 = Live frequency to counter (POCA)

Field_Character.name: Frequency Counter 2 Mode Register
Field_Character.description: Possible (bit string) values include: 0000 = Test frequency to counter 0001 = Live frequency to counter (POCA)

Field_Character.name: Spares-1
Field_Character.description: An unused field in the binary file; contents are undefined.

Field_Character.name: Zeroes-1
Field_Character.description: An unused field in the binary file; set to zero here.

Field_Character.name: 20-Counter
Field_Character.description: A field with unknown meaning. The SIS says it contains the octal value 023; but the Voyager 2 Uranus data from Parkes have decimal 23 or decimal 0. The value appears twice in adjacent bytes in the binary records; only one is carried here.

Field_Character.name: Zeroes-2
Field_Character.description: An unused field in the binary file; set to zero here.

Field_Character.name: Overflow Flag
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that there has been an overflow. A value 0 indicates no overflow. The Overflow Flag appears twice in the binary record (in binary Fields 27 and 28). Only the first is carried here.

Field_Character.name: Ones
Field_Character.description: A binary value 111 (decimal 7) is expected from the SIS; but Voyager 2 Uranus records from Parkes have either binary 100 or binary 000. The Ones field appears twice in the binary record (in binary Fields 27 and 28). Only the first is carried here.

Field_Character.name: Test Mode
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that test data were acquired. A value 0 indicates that normal data were acquired. Test Mode appears twice in the binary record (in binary Fields 27 and 28). Only the first is carried here.

Field_Character.name: Short Conversions
Field_Character.description: A value 1 indicates that 8-bit data were acquired. A value 0 indicates that 12-bit data were acquired. Short Conversions appears twice in the binary record (in binary Fields 27 and 28). Only the first is carried here.

Field_Character.name: Sampling Mode
Field_Character.description: A value 0 indicates that 4 different signals were sampled, each at SRATE. A value 1 indicates that one signal was sampled (using 4 ADCs) at an effective sampling rate of 4*SRATE. A value 2 indicates that two signals were sampled, each using 2 ADCs; the effective sampling rate on each signal was 2*SRATE. A value 3 indicates that two signals were sampled. The first signal was sampled using ADC-1 at SRATE; the second signal was sampled using ADC-2, ADC-3, and ADC-4 at 3*SRATE. Mode 3 could be used to sample and record an S-band signal using ADC-1 and an X-band signal using the other ADCs at 3 times the S-band rate. Sampling Mode appears twice in each binary record (in binary Fields 27-28). Only the first is carried forward here.

Table_Character.name: PODR X-band ASCII Raw Data Samples
Table_Character.description: PODR X-band data samples converted to ASCII.

Field_Character.name: Original Record Number
Field_Character.description: The number of the record in the original binary file from which these samples came, counting from 1.

Field_Character.name: Original Sample Number
Field_Character.description: The number of the first sample in this record as it appeared in the original binary record, counting from 0.

Group_Field_Character.name: Data Samples
Group_Field_Character.description: Each field contains one X-band sample value in the range 0 to 255.

Field_Character.name: Sample
Field_Character.description: One X-band sample from the original binary data record.

Stream_Text.name: Record Header File - Field Headers
Stream_Text.description: This file contains field headers for the ASCII file containing PODR record headers. There are 45 fixed-width fields, delimited by commas, in the ASCII data file. The 45 field headers in this file are also delimited by commas; but they have variable widths. Record 1 in this file contains column names; record 2 contains formats for the values in the column. It should be possible to read both the data file with record headers and this file of field headers into a spreadsheet, such as Excel.
